ticket.description: Strange things can happen when FileSender is served via HTTPS but the site_url mentions http. In this case, the user was able to log in but not upload, the error message was terasender_source_file_not_available which of course is not very descriptive. I suggest the following behaviour: If $_SERVER['HTTPS'] && $_SERVER['HTTPS'] != 'off' and site_url does *not* start with https://, then log a warning. The reason for not detecting the opposite, is that the detection may be fooled by a reverse proxy.
ticket.summary: Log a warning when observed protocol is more secure than site_url

ticket.description:
Apple applications (Ortelius, but also Mac Write I believe) uses a compound file format that stores stuff in a directory structure. As long as we can not transfer folders, transferring these types of files is not supported. Workaround: zip them.
filesender-nren-services-in-europe.ortl: total 920 drwxr-xr-x@ 6 meijer staff 204 Jun 20 14:15 . drwx------ 65 meijer staff 2210 Jun 20 14:25 .. -rw-r--r-- 1 meijer staff 17003 Jun 20 14:03 MD_Auxiliary_Info.dat -rw-r--r-- 1 meijer staff 444351 Jun 20 14:03 MD_Content.drawing -rw-r--r-- 1 meijer staff 1078 Jun 20 14:03 MD_Info.plist drwxr-xr-x 3 meijer staff 102 Jun 20 14:03 QuickLook
I wonder: if we could read through a folder, could we stream-zip it?
ticket.summary: Document known issue / FAQ regarding upload of compound file formats on Mac
Document $config['stalling_detection']

ticket.description:
Add feedback email handling script and bounce handling related default config.
Script can be called as :
php cron/emailfeedback.php [options] [sources]
options are : * --remove_after_processing : remove file after processing * --move_after_processing[=target] : move file to target folder after processing, if no absolute target will be considered to be under source folder, if no target given "done" source subfolder is used by default
sources can be (several may be used at the same time) : * a path to a file containing a rfc822 message * a path to a folder containing rfc822 message files * - to get rfc822 message from standard input
if no sources are defined standard input is used by default
New config parameters related to bounce handling :
report_bounces, bounces reporting mode, possible values are : - null / false / 0 : bounce reporting disabled (bounces are still saved and displayed in ui, just not reported by email) - asap : report every bounce right away (default) - daily : compile a daily report for each transfer/guest (handled by cron/cron.php) - asap_then_daily : bounces in a time range (see report_bounces_asap_then_daily_range) after transfer/guest creation are reported right away, bounces comming after are reported daily
report_bounces_asap_then_daily_range, time range for asap reporting in asap_then_daily bounce reporting mode, in seconds, defaults to 15 minutes
Files Affected: A /filesender/branches/filesender-2.0/cron/emailfeedback.php M /filesender/branches/filesender-2.0/includes/ConfigDefaults.php
Commit from user: etiennemeleard
............................................................................. More details at: https://www.assembla.com/code/file_sender/subversion/changesets/3271
ticket.summary: Add documentation for bounce handling (general explain + config directive)

ticket.description:
Add to general API documentation (?) and config directives if needed.
"Add a way to use webservice as a remote user (!= remote application).
It must be enabled using the auth_remote_user_enabled configuration parameter (boolean, false by default).
It uses a signed request (same as remote applications), the only difference is that each user have its own secret (stored as a preference).
Secrets can be automatically generated by setting auth_remote_user_autogenerate_secret configuration parameter to true (false by default).
It will allow to setup per-user based trust relationships between a filesender instance and other, potentially non-web based, applications.
Use case is a Thunderbird plugin which allows to put big files on filesender, user installs the plugin and give its secret to it, then the plugin can upload files on behalf of the user.
Sample php client has been updated to be able to use either remote application or remote user authentication.
Files Affected: M /filesender/branches/filesender-2.0/classes/auth/Auth.class.php A /filesender/branches/filesender-2.0/classes/auth/AuthRemoteUser.class.php M /filesender/branches/filesender-2.0/classes/data/User.class.php A /filesender/branches/filesender-2.0/classes/exceptions/AuthRemoteUserExceptions.class.php M /filesender/branches/filesender-2.0/includes/ConfigDefaults.php M /filesender/branches/filesender-2.0/scripts/client/FilesenderRestClient.class.php M /filesender/branches/filesender-2.0/scripts/client/FilesenderRestClientExample.php
Commit from user: etiennemeleard
............................................................................. More details at: https://www.assembla.com/code/file_sender/subversion/changesets/3396"
ticket.summary: Document access web service as remote user (!= remote application)

Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2015 18:51:16 From: etiennemeleard <file_sender@alerts.assembla.com> Reply-To: filesender-alerts@filesender.org To: "filesender alerts user adminned by Jan (filesender-alerts)" <filesender-alerts@filesender.org> Subject: [filesender-alerts] [Assembla] [File sender] Changeset [3397]: Add a configurable user profile page (disabled by default). Parts/Attachments: 1 Shown 48 lines Text 2 OK 35 lines Text ----------------------------------------
Changeset alert by etiennemeleard in project FileSender
.............................................................................
Add a configurable user profile page (disabled by default).
The goal is to create a framework for user preferences managment.
To enable it set the "user_page" configuration parameter to an array containing <preference_id> : <view_mode> pairs.
View modes can be "read", "write" or false (same as not set, that is will not be displayed).
Supported preferences are :
- lang (requires lang_userpref_enabled to true) : supports read and write - auth_secret (requires auth_remote_user_enabled), supports only read - created, supports only read

ticket.description:
Tested in both 1.6 and 2.0.
When uploading a large file (50GB in our case) through Internet Explorer 11, the upload stalls somewhere halfway. We've received reports stating that they stop at 12%, in my own tests they've stopped at 48% in FileSender 2.0 and 78% in FileSender 1.6. The log files make no mention of anything amiss. I wasn't able to reproduce this with other browsers.
Tested with Internet Explorer 11 on Windows Server 2012R2, got reports about Internet Explorer 11 on Windows 7.
ticket.summary: Large files stall on Internet Explorer 11

ticket.description:
Issue: avg. upload speed counter goes berzerk after an upload restart.
Solution: We keep track of the time upload is started or restarted (reset at restart), for each file: got global size and uploaded size. In order to know how fast we go, we take total time it took and do a division. At one point we reset one counter and not the other. Need to know “this transfer is restarting”, need to get sum of offsets, and substract it from speed computation.
ticket.summary: Fix average upload speed counter to work properly after upload resume

A number of 3rd party modules are used in FileSender. These need to be documented to facilitate security audits and reviews and to document which external modules we need to track. Note to self: we should find a way to track external modules in an automatic and systematic way.
Backend e.g. dom pdf is used to generate audit trails in PDF format. Front-end a number of JavaScript libraries are used, e.g. JQuery.
These 3rd party modules need to be listed on a separate page, with URLs to project, to how we can see current version and how how we can track them. We also should indicate which versions of these modules are included in a specific release.

ticket.description:
When an upload complete, a dialog appears stating that the upload has completed. This is good. But it closes in 15 seconds, after which is redirects to the upload page again, which then shows no indication of that the previous upload succeeded.
This is annoying if you leave the computer while uploading completes, because you have to do extra work to check that the upload succeeded. Even more so if you checked the «Get a link instead of sending to recipients» checkbox, because then you must find the link in «My Transfers».
ticket.summary: Upload complete dialog should not auto-close

ticket.description:
If this transfer option is set with a valid URL the user is redirected to this URL on transfer uploading completion rather than being presented with the "upload complete" dialogue.
This transfer option can not be set in the UI, it needs to be set with an API call.
The use case is using a separate FileSender service to upload big files to a digital exam system. * a student uses a digital exam to hand in an exam * the student wants to attach a file to the exam system by way of an external filesender service * on clicking the "attach big file" link the digital exam system creates a guest voucher for that particular student/exam session and redirects the user to the guest invitation URL. In the guest invitation the transfer option "redirect_url_on_upload_complete" is set to the digital exam system * the user uploads the file, on upload complete the user is redirected back to the digital exam system * the digital exam system downloads the file to its own repository
ticket.summary: Transfer option: redirect_url_on_upload_complete

ticket.description:
When creating a guest invitation the authenticated user specifies which transfer options the guest's transfer will have.
* the set of available transfer options the authenticated user can specify for a guest transfer is the same as for a transfer by an authenticated user (and defined by FileSender server configuration). * by default a number of transfer options are set as per FileSender server configuration * When logged in as guest, you can see which transfer options are set but you can not change them.
ticket.summary: Transfer options in guest invitation

ticket.description:
*Issue:* _vulnerability:_ there is no protection against click-jacking nor do we mention clickjacking as a risk anywhere in the installation documentation. Recommendation is to set the x-frame-header in each request or same-origin, allow-from in the webserver config and/or document in the manual what to do if iframes are allowed. Either we document the risks with using iframes or ensure they can't be used.
*Assessment*: this is both a risk and a feature. Integrating FileSender using an iframe is a feature. Should you want to limit inclusion of FileSender in iframes, preliminary investigation suggests W3C's candidate recommendation Content Security Policy (CSP, http://www.w3.org/TR/CSP2/) is the standards-based way to do this. According to http://caniuse.com/#feat=contentsecuritypolicy this is supported on most currrent browsers. IE11 is supported by adding X-Content-Security-Policy. Daan suggests to set the same-origin header in the Apache config.
*Response*: as this is both a feature and a vulnerability we will not enforce this in the FileSender application. We will use CSP to allow for fine-grained protection. Rather than implement a swath of config options in FileSender we will document how to configure CSP in Apache for use with FileSender to prevent inclusion in iframes.
ticket.summary: Security audit 1: 2.11.8: Anti-clickjacking measures must be implemented

ticket.description:
Cloned from a known issue in versin 1.6, ticket #1137. Need to verify this is no longer a bug in version 2.0. If this is a bug in 2.0 it should be fixed.
setting $config['ban_extension'] to '' (= empty string) or null should allow all extensions, including 'no' extension. However the current code takes it too literally and will prevent the sending of files without extension. So the following files will be marked as 'invalid':
empty-extension. no-extension
As noticed by MeRC on the AARNet Cloudstor install and reported by Wendy.
ticket.summary: Bug from prev. release: Empty/null $config['ban_extension'] prevents sending files with no extension

ticket.description:
When I run createtransfer.php as my own user, I get a lot of the following error message: 
failed to open stream: Permission denied in /usr/local/filesender/filesender-2.0/classes/utils/Logger.class.php on line 353
When I run it as root instead it works, but now I get this error when I try to run FileSender from the webbrowser. This happens because createtransfer.php may create a new logfile, and this new logfile will then be owned by the user that ran createtransfer.php. The following things need to be taken care of: * If log files can't be written, the script should abort. * If log files can be written, they should either be chowned to the webserver, or made group-writeable.
ticket.summary: Using `createtransfer.php` must check that it runs from the correct user.

ticket.description:
Clone from ticket #999. Need to check what happens when in current 2.0-alpha the file suddenly no longer can be read (for example because it was deleted by the user while uploading).
For details see related (original) ticket #999.
Required for both HTML5 and Tera Sender.
Scenario: start large file upload from USB disk, USB disk unplugges, HTML5 upload script can no longer read file, and upload hangs.
What probably shoudl happen is that when the next chunk of file being uploaded can't be read, after a certain timeout a dialogue ought to pop up "having trouble reading file, cancel upload yes/no?" and maybe even include a "should I try to resume" question. At the very least the user needs to be made aware of the possibility to resume. Most people won't know this and especially for larger files it would be .... annoying.
ticket.summary: Error message required when HTML5/Terasender upload javascript can no longer read file

ticket.description: We keep running into problems with especially large uploads (100s of GB), using specific browsers (IE 11) or boundary conditions (25+ workers). We need to: - document TeraSender functionality: implementation, design, flow - analyse whether this is good enough - change where needed

ticket.description:
May be related to #1270. When the config looks like this: 

$config['terasender_enabled'] = true; // true/false
$config['terasender_advanced'] =  true; // true/false - terasender advanced - show advanced settings
$config['terasender_chunk_size'] = 5 * 1024 * 1024;        // default (5) terasender chunk size
$config['terasender_worker_count'] = 30;        // default (6) worker count
$config['terasender_start_mode'] = 'multiple'; // "single" to start all workers on the first file, "multiple" to dispatch them on all files
Uploads of small files fail. I tried with a file of 329 bytes. Trial and error showed me that uploading would succeed when using at most 20 workers, 21 and more fail. When uploading fails, the file appears green just as it should and the logs show that upload succeeded, just as it should, but the UI hangs there. Refreshing the page shows that uploading failed and offers to try again, with the same result. Changing the chunk size didn't seem to make any difference. ticket.description:
Copied from the version 1.6 known issue list. This seems to still be a problem in version 2.0.
On the "Guest Voucher" page, if one starts to type a recipient email address and then clicks on the "Delete" button, the warning "Invalid or missing email" appears and the "Delete" button is highlighted, but the voucher does not delete (reported by Wendy). If one (without changing anything) then clicks on the "Delete" button again the confirmation dialog appears, then clicking "Yes" deletes the voucher and clears/reloads the page (noted by Xander).
ticket.summary: Guest Voucher manual deletion interrupted if "invalid or missing email" warning triggered

ticket.description:
Document the workflow for how we go from feature suggestion to feature release, including where we docuent the various steps.
The current process I envision after 2.0:
- we have a list of feature suggestions somewhere - at some point in time we start working on a new release. For example release 2.1. - release 2.1 will have a number of feature tickets under it. - once we pick up on a suggestion we mark the suggestion as "underway" in the feature suggestion list and relate it to the relevant feature implementation ticket - in the feature suggestion list the feature is closed once the feature is implemented.
A challenge at the moment is that we have a feature suggestion forum at uservoice and a list of suggested features in Assembla. These should be consolidated at some point in time. A challenge with this is that Uservoice has removed its free offer from its pricing structure. At the moment we can still use it but I don't feel comfortable this'll last forever. In any case it is not a desirable situation to be in.
Remember to include "language string freeze" in the process to get from alpha to release (!)
ticket.summary: Document feature suggestion -> implementation workflow

ticket.description:
our release policy states a release candidate will be field-tested on at least two FileSender release candidate test sites: - Production sites with at least X transfers by X unique users per day. - The sites run with well-known configurations making what are considered standard features available to their user bases.
for a release candidate to become a production release it needs to have been running production traffic with live users for at least two weeks on at least two release candidate test sites and shown no significant issues impairing service for the users, it can become the production (major) release.
This implies we need at least to FileSEnder release candidate sites. A site would need to install a release candidate within a certain number of time after release, for example a week. A release candidate site should typically get a heads up at least 2 weeks in advance before release.
Preferably we would have a similar mechanism for beta testing sites so we get some organised feedback on the quality of a beta. However, the release candidate sites are more important.
ticket.summary: Establish list of beta and release candidate sites

ticket.description:

Date: Tue, 23 Nov 2010 12:25:52 +0100 From: Guido Aben <Guido.Aben@aarnet.edu.au> Reply-To: filesender-dev@filesender.org To: filesender-dev@filesender.org Cc: filesender-dev@filesender.org, epires@fccn.pt, nuno@fccn.pt Subject: Re: [filesender-dev] filesender - eduPersonTargetedID attribute
You can very well operate without ePTID. AARNet runs its filesender install without it. We simply translate the attribute and replace it with the email attribute -- sufficiently pseudopermanent for our purposes.
Guido

ticket.description:
We need to know what it would mean to use a "test platform as a service" like Sauce Labs. Sauce Labs offers selenium based testing as a service. For open source projects the service can be used for free.
If such a service could work for us it presumably gives us: - an opportunity to scale testing to many more browsers without incurring an increase in time use - an opportunity to let anyone run tests once tests have been defined. This opens up for including running defined end user workflow tests in the development of new features /fixing of bugs: development is ready once the existing tests succeed
https://saucelabs.com/resources
Create a test account at Sauce Labs, take one feature from FileSender 2.0, for example the "drag and drop file selection" feature, and try to create a Sauce Labs test for this. From their feature list they should have PHP bindings, I would think it would be most convenient for the FileSender project to define its Selenium-server tests in PHP. The Sauce Labs web site has plenty of documentation to get you started :) Sauce Labs allows to import Selenium IDE scripts, which may be useful. Would be convenient to know if there is an effort difference between importing IDE created scripts and writing tests in code.
You can test against https://terasender.uninett.no/branches/filesender-2.0/ until further notice. Login using an OpenIdP account, self-registration should still be possible (OpenIdP is being phased out).
What I'm after is a first impression of using Sauce Labs for practical testing.
ticket.summary: Investigate whole testing chain with Saucelabs for 1 feature and report

ticket.description:
With every release we have had and will have known issues: stuff we know is broken but we either will not (lack of resources/priority) or can not (3rd party issues) fix. We kept track of these issues so we could try and fix them in new releases. So far we've done this with putting an issue in the "Deferred" state: an issue is deferred to a later time. However, deferred is an open ticket status. I have a strong desire to be able to close milestones; it makes it much clearer what we are working on and what not. This would also allow us to start using Assembla for more than ticket adminstration; we can start using its project management features to have better control over our efforts.
As an example: release 1.1 and 1.5 we are not working on. Tickets in those milestones will never be worked on again. Still they remain open.
What I want is: - a milestone per release and the ability to close milestones we no longer work on - a record of known issues per release without those issues remaining open tickets after we've decided we will not work on them for that particular release.
Any change of the policy for dealing with known issues will need to be updated in the ticket status guide https://www.assembla.com/spaces/file_sender/wiki/Ticket_Status_Guide
ticket.summary: Establish policy for dealing with known issues

ticket.description:
Behaviour: after logging on a user is simply redirected to the logon page. Logging of SimpleSAMLphp seems to indicate the user is not logged on, no authenticated session is created.
FileSender 2.0 explicitly sets the session.cookie.path to the site URL on initialisation. Usually this points to / and won't cause any issues for the standard setup with simplesamlphp where simplesamlphp is in a separate URL space from FileSender.
However, on my testing machine and for example for launching our filesender.uninett.no/beta service this is a bit different and hence sessions between simplesamlphp and filesender are not accepted by filesender. With Shibboleth this is not an issue as it uses its own session variable handling. SimpleSAMLphp is in php and shares with PHP.
Agreed solution: introduce a configuration parameter session_cookie_path. When using SimpleSAMLphp in a URL path other than /, you need to configure this to for example /.
If the parameter is not set, FileSender uses the default application path which is either specified in site_url or extracted from the application environment.
ticket.summary: Logon problem with SimpleSAMLphp in different URL space (session.cookie.path)

ticket.description:

ticket.description:
Experience shows a transfer limit of 30 files is not enough. We need a better reasonable default. We need to assess whether there is a reason this can't be unlimited.
Practical limits: - table of contents in download zip file of 2^64 files (64 bit offset) - maximum number of records in SQL table -most likely a practical limit in the file selection box, probably "over a few 1000" because we would be creating a lot of HTML nodes. The page would be sloooooow.
Probably not a problem to setting it to 2000, over that may have implications for memory use.
We will configure a default file limit of 2000 per transfer
ticket.summary: Reconsider default limit on #files per transfer

ticket.description:
On (at least) Mac OSX filenames with certain Unicode characters tend to be represented as 'decomposed unicode' (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unicode_equivalence for an explanation). Although FileSender transparantly handles those decomposed characters and leaves the actual handling to the browser and OS it looks like most notably Windows (when storing a file with 'decomposed unicode' characters from FireFox/Chrome) and IE11 (when displaying those files in My Files or a download page) doesn't handle those characters as expected.
We might consider 'fixing' this in FileSender by normalizing 'decomposed unicode' to 'precomposed unicode'.
Considerations: - The normalizer_normalize function of the PHP intl extension can be used for this, this requires PHP 5.3+ and adds extra dependencies (php5-intl, libicu) - Should we normalize when uploading (before storing the filename into the database) or only when displaying/downloading?
This ticket was cloned from the 1.6 milestone: we need to check whether this is still an issue with the current 2.0 code and if it is, whether we can resolve it.
ticket.summary: Handling decomposed unicode in filenames
Bug: Time zone not honoured in audit log

ticket.description:
When using (very) fast connexion the "file complete" and "transfer complete" are sometimes sent several times due to multiple workers reporting completion in a very short time and first "completion trigger" request not being already completed and transfer flagged as such before next trigger comes.
Some kind of locking mechanism is needed.
ticket.summary: Race condition during upload

ticket.description:
Scenario: start large file upload from USB disk, USB disk unplugges, HTML5 upload script can no longer read file, and upload hangs.
What probably shoudl happen is that when the next chunk of file being uploaded can't be read, after a certain timeout a dialogue ought to pop up "having trouble reading file, cancel upload yes/no?" and maybe even include a "should I try to resume" question. At the very least the user needs to be made aware of the possibility to resume. Most people won't know this and especially for larger files it would be .... annoying.
ticket.summary: No error message when HTML5 upload javascript can no longer read file

ticket.summary: Create standard configuration file template with sane defaults

ticket.description:
implement auto-refresh after click on download in MyTransfers.
This ticket is a clone from ticket #984, remaining work from version 1.6.
When a user downloads a file via the My Transfer table entry, the download counters do not get incremented until the page is refreshed. In version 1.6 we did not have a reliable way to detect whether a download was complete or cancelled. In 2.0 we can detect up to all but the last chunk whether a download was successfull.
We create an event in the audit trail log for "Recipient X finished downloading <file> (size)" on when sending the last chunk of a download (Etienne, that is correct, right?).
That means we make an assumption in the audit log that afer the last download chuk is sent the file was downloaded. We may as well refresh the my transfer page when that event occurs in the download case of downloading via my transfers.
ticket.summary: implement auto-refresh after click on download from My Transfers table

This could result in the uploader prematurely manually deleting an uploaded file, thinking that their recipient has already downloaded it.

ticket.description:
Etienne,
I just tested a 200 GB upload, my laptop crashed for some non-related reason (I hope) about 5GB before the upload was done. After I waited about 4 hours for the 195 GB to complete it was rather frustrating to start again from scratch especially considering we have basic upload resume in version 1.6 ;)
Basic upload resume should be part of version 2.0 as well. If you as a user select the exact same files as you had before the crash it should be possible to simply resume the upload. I think most of the under-the-hood feature is already there? Your comments please :)

ticket.description:
When a user accesses the "Transfer audit log" overview (either via the button in the expanded My Transfers entry, or via the entry's icon in the My Transfers overview) the user should be able to click a button to send the audit log by email.
When the audit log is sent, the user gets feedbackin the UI that the mail was sent.
Notes regarding current implementation (january 2016): - the button "send audit log by email" should be centered in the audit log window - there currently is no user feedback when the button is clicked. This is confusing, as a user you don't know if something happened or if the button is just a "big button that doesn't do anything".
ticket.summary: Email audit log

ticket.description: Allow a user to download either all or a selection of available files in one go. The files would end up in a .zip archive on the end user's machine. The user should be able to open the .zip file with built-in file manaement tool (typically Windows Explorer or Apple Finder).
ticket.summary: Download: download all files at once into an archive

ticket.description:
The audit log is supposed to give an overview of what happend to a transfer when and by whom.
The current audit log is implemented in such a way that it stores identifiers to for example a recipient entry in the recipient table rather than the actual values. Deleting a recipient leads to dangling identifiers in the audit log. This again breaks audit log viewing in the web interface and sending the audit log by email.
There are several ways to solve this, not all are equally desirable. We need to revisit what exactly the audit log shoudl provide as a feature before making a decision. This ticket will be linked to a feature specification ticket for that reason.
ticket.summary: Bug: Recipient removal breaks audit log

ticket.description:
I managed to trip this one by configuring Norwegian as the only language in locale.php while that's not set as the default language
The GUI says "Configuration error(s), please check the server logs or ask an admin to do so." while the Apache server log says "Sep 17 10:42:15 terasender apache2: ConfigValidator "default_language" does not validate check : default_language must be one of the available languages defined in locale.php (no)".
There is no logging in the FileSender log. Where do messages from the ConfigValidator go? If they always go to "wherever PHP logs" we need to state "check your PHP server logs" in this error.
Another consideration: we state that the hard coded language of last resort is always "en". However, in this case that is not true. So either I need to change the language config documentation or we need to change this from a fatal error to a (severe) warning?

ticket.description:
(theory start)
When uploading a huge file slowly at some point the computer goes to sleep.
That ends up having incomplete chunk upload requests being sent (400 code by apache, php not executed).
After computer awakes the stalled transfer mechanism triggers (no feedback from workers over too long) but transfer cannot be restarted because XSRF token expired.
(theory end)
We need a mechanism able to figure out that nothing happened over more than XSRF token lifetime and refresh said token (not over WS call obviously, more like an hidden iframe in which we load the home page and fetch the token from it, possible since same domain).
This could be an extension of stalled transfer detection.
ticket.summary: Upload broken by computer sleep mode (it seems)

ticket.description:
This allows to interrupt the service for database upgrade or even server restart without breaking uploads.
When switched on: - all pages are replaced with the maintenance page - webservice returns specific exception to all requests - clients display a popup explaining what happens - clients pause uploads and put all requests they were about to make in a stack - clients starts to query the server on a regular basis to see if maintenance ended (server responding with no exception status) - when server exits maintenance mode clients restart uploading and run stacked requests and remove maintenance popup
Config directive is config parameter "maintenance" that is boolean and false by default.
implemented in ticket #1182.
ticket.summary: Admin: maintenance mode

ticket.description:
OpenIdP will be phased out per 1 January 2016. I've verified internally at UNINETT that the entire OpenIdP service will disappear, it also will not be accessible for me as a UNINETT employee. AFAIK there are no current alternatives available that do the exact same.
The FileSender project uses openidp.feide.no as an IdP for the following purposes:
1. test accounts for (automated, selenium-based) client-side testing. 2. ensuring federated login is tested before we release 3. as the default IdP new FileSender installations can authenticate against. This ensures the 1-hour setup time. 4. as a self-registration user account system for demo (test) instances
Considerations with the purpose 1, use for test accounts: - the credentials need to be able to be exposed to external services without problems, like selenium service providers. Credential exposure should not lead to possible compromise of other services - we need to be able to specify which email addresses are associated with the test accounts
Considerations with purpose 3, use by new FileSender instances to test their installation - no default username/password should be distributed with a FileSender release
We will need to find a (combination of) alternative(s).
ticket.summary: Find alternatives to OpenIdP accounts

ticket.description:
*Issue:* _defence in depth:_ when FileSender receives user input the function sanitizeInput is used to ensure the input will not contain anything that will be executed. This function currently filters the input for a number of dangerous characters and adds a space to them. Pine recommends to use escaping, the current code uses filtering.
Filtering changes the input and might lead to unexpected side-effects.
*Assessment*: Etienne's collegues in the Sympa mailinglist software project had a security audit executed where an issue was found using variable encoded string injection. The offending string had to be machine-generated. This string defeated perls regexp-based entity encoding mechanism. The php mechanism behaved the same. Sympa introduced a filtering fix which was reported in this FileSender audit. The filtering fix was based on a blog-article published on OWASP as a recommendation. Unfortunately the blog article is now no longer accessible.
Daan indicated he's unaware of any technique to bypass html_entities. He tested by removing the line of code and injection of code was not possible. The strong recommendation is to not filter on input; you don't know where the data will be used.
*Response:* there is not yet consensus in the FileSender core team on the best approach. Based on the experience of the Sympa mailinglist software team escaping alone might not be enough. The issue found in the Sympa security audit might now have been fixed and the filtering fix no longer needed. We will await the results of the 2nd security audit and then decide what to do. We will address this before the 2.0 release.
ticket.summary: Securit audit 1: 2.7.1: User input must be encoded in the context where it is used

ticket.description:
Symptom: the upload succeeds, mails are sent, but there is still an error both to user + in the logs on server side.
Upload of a 5GB file on terasender.uninett.no/branches/filesender-2.0/ The upload was with Safari. That instance is now configured with 6 webworkers. I did the upload over the WLAN.
A couple of times the message was displayed "slower than usual, try again, quit etc.". I clicked try again, it hopped a bit back in progress and the progressed.
At the end, the progress bar indicated the upload was complete, I got the download email, and I got an error (enclosed in this mail) that there was a problem.
In the logs server side I can see there's a problem logged.
On disk the file appears to be all there: -rw-r--r-- 1 www-data www-data 5368710144 Feb 9 11:35 397b17f7-bccf-a1d8-c600-41d72a7ca092
It also downloads again: -rw-r--r--@ 1 meijer staff 5368710144 Feb 9 11:18 testfile-5GB+1byte-2.dat
Etienne's analysis:
* When last worker finishes: triggers file complete request. When all files are complete, transfer complete request is sent. Normally triggers mail sending etc. * After this transfer complete request was sent another chunk was sent. The webservice doesn’t accept chunks after a transfer complete is sent. the client should NOT send chunks after transfer complete. * this MAY happen in one case only, with the automatic restart of stalled transfers. * There are TWO automatic restarts of a transfer before asking whether a transfer should restart so a user won't see if a transfer restarts only once
There might be a situation where the transfer is both complete and restarted. Etienne will add more logging to see if restarts have an unfortunate timing.
This is a bug we need to fix.
ticket.summary: A chunk was sent after transfer complete resulting in an error

ticket.description:
If you set the number of webworkers to be used to 30, uploading works fine with Safari and Chrome, but not with FireFox. Confirmed on UNINETT and DeIC 2.0 test install. Symptom: just nothing happens and nothing is logged.
Set the number of workers to 16 and it also works with FireFox.
Etienne provides following feedback:
The mechanism in a terasender upload is as follows: - a worker requests a job with the terasender job driver - the job driver locks (sets boolean in itself) so it doesn't respond to multiple workers. If another worker tries to access it it tells the other worker to wait. This ensures no chunk is given to two workers. - the driver gives a worker an answer; either "here is a chunk for you" or "nothing more to do".
if this messaging mechanism breaks down nothing will work.
Thoughts: - maybe past a certain number of workers with each worker waiting for .5 seconds, with a lot of workers it may be just waiting? - maybe there's some overflow in the messaging system in FireFox? - upon checking the upload console: every worker is requesting a job. First worker is given file, other worker gets “nothing to do” as a response. Are expected to close. First worker doesn’t even signal worker is complete. Past specific number of workers the browser starts to handle events in a bad way. -Is the bug related to max number of workers or to large number of workers combined with async uplods? -what is the breaking number? -maybe there is a limit in the global amount of “work” FireFox can do? That Safari and Chrome doesn’t have? Does messaging just break down?
Etienne will take following actions: - test to see if there is a specific fixed breaking point in # webworkers - check Mozilla email list for similar issues and write email asking others if they've seen similar things - post on Stack overflow
This is not a high priority issue at the moment: just don't set the #webworkers to 30 does the trick. But we need to figure out what causes this. If it's a firefox bug it should be fixed. If it is some issue in our code it should be fixed.
For the 2.0-alpha we will -unless we find out what causes it- label this as a known issue for now.
ticket.summary: FireFox upload hangs with 30 workers

ticket.description:
'Pause/Resume' 'Suspend' and 'Cancel' buttons need to be added to the progress bar dialog box.
Pause should *temporarily* stop the uploading of files until the user chooses to resume them (via the same button). Using this will *not* allow the user to resume after leaving this page and is used to relieve the users bandwidth temporarily.
Suspend should make it possible for users to stray away from the transaction and continue it as part of another session, this would be an explicit version of the pause/resume functionality which is currently in place. Users should be warned after choosing 'suspend' of how it works and the steps required to come back to this transaction. This should be paired with functionality which tells users they have a pending upload transaction and should continue to ask them if they wish to either continue with the upload or cancel it. This will only work when the user uses the same browser&computer combination to resume the upload. Some way, for example via a button/dropdown list/dialog for the user to access a list of their suspended transactions. This stops the user from having to repopulate the list themselves and would essentially make the uploads page re-appear how they left if (any file uploads complete in that transaction would still be there with complete progress bars). Suspended transactions should have some form of expiration date. Requires validations/error checks to ensure the pending files still exist on disk.
Cancel should forfeit the transaction and stop *all* files (both those already finished and those in the queue). Downloads do not have to be paused to be cancelled, but a warning 'are you sure?' should be provided.
ticket.summary: Pause / Resume on (Multi)file Uploads

ticket.description:
Reported by Lubos Kopecky.
IE shows me error:
Webpage error details
User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; Trident/4.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; .NET4.0C) Timestamp: Mon, 10 Feb 2014 21:23:12 UTC
Message: Object doesn't support this property or method Line: 649 Char: 1 Code: 0
Relates to addEventListener not a function in IE - needs to detect if addEventListener is available or replace with attachEvent.This is an IE specific issue.
Code below: window.addEventListener('keydown', function(e) {(e.keyCode == 27 && e.preventDefault())})
Fix: Replace with. if (window.addEventListener){ window.addEventListener('keydown', function(e) {(e.keyCode == 27 && e.preventDefault())}) } else if (window.attachEvent){ window.attachEvent('onkeydown', function(e) {(e.keyCode == 27 && e.preventDefault())}) }
ticket.summary: Javascript errors when using IE

Create a script that sends a summary of key statistics (e.g. numbers of users, upload, downloads, active files and a comparison to previous month) by email to the site admin. Should be institution specific in cases where such information is included with user credentials (will need an additional logs table field).
Could be done as an optional cron job. Storing parsed data in an additional DB table specifically for this purpose might be best, although all stats can be retrieved from the logs table.
Input Xander: if org-attribuut then instelling = org-attribuut else instelling = domein authuseremail
Implement stats both as email and once queries are settled, implement as "stats" tab.
About access control: lets start with what we concluded in the stats module but without the "user". $config['stats_access_level'] = 'statsadmin'; // Who can access stats page. Possible settings are 'statsadmin', 'public' or 'disabled'. A more restrictive setting here would override the access settings below.
To start with the key stats from the stats module are probably useful. Would be wonderful to have those key stats both per filesender instans and per institution. Would also be helpful to be able to indicate different timeperiods (up to 10?) you'd like to see next to eachother for easy comparison, for example key stats for 2010-2013, or for march 2012 vs. march 2013, especially when thinking of visiting institutions for marketing purposes etc.
*Note: we do need to discuss the need for anonimisation/aggregation: do we already do this for a simple stats function in 2.0 "asap" or would we postpone it to after we have the key numbers?* First thought: let us focus on making key numbers per instans and site available ASAP, based on current database tables. Phase 2: once key stats have stabilised, work out proper way for anonimisation and aggregation, possibly prepared for phase 3: allow sending aggregates/anonimised stats to centralised collector. Phase 4: pretty pictures.
ticket.summary: Script to send a stats summary by email to site admin

ticket.description:
In connection with a technical overhaul of the admin panel (new table layout, bug fixes), it would be convenient to discuss and rethink any changes to the information that the admin panel contains in 2.0. E.g. representation of multi-file transactions, email settings or more sophisticated statistics.
Discussion appreciated.
ticket.summary: Changes to admin.php

ticket.description: Ticket already exists for 1.6 release, #999. Plan is to fix in 2.0 and backport if appropriate to 1.6. Please discuss details with Chris.
ticket.summary: 2.0: Error message required when HTML5/Terasender upload javascript can no longer read file

ticket.description: Ticket exists in for 1.6 (deferred), see #905. Idea is to try and fix this in 2.0 and backport if possible.
ticket.summary: in 2.0: Modify session validity check on upload to allow for very long uploads

ticket.description:
Consider an audit trail functionality.
One way to implement this is to show a historical MyFiles. Disadvantage: requires audit trail data to hang around. That's contrary our wish to retain least possible sensitive data on the FileSender service.
Another and possibly easier way: once the transaction expires, wrap the entire transaction history in a PDF and ship it to the sender. This PDF could be timestamped and signed to provide strength to the audit trail.
This would be accompanied by a config option that says "always on" or "user override", and in case of the latter would either tick it by default or leave it open by default. A service admin would need to be able to indicate whether this optoin is part of the standard "always show" options or not.
ticket.summary: New feature suggestion: transaction audit trail

ticket.description:
Ticket already exists as #892, deferred for the 1.6 release. Idea is to fix this in 2.0 (most of the fix is already there I bleieve in trunk) and backport solution to 1.6 if appropriate.
Please discuss details with Chris, as with the other "fix these 1.6 deferred problems in 2.0" tickets :)
ticket.summary: 2.0: The customCSS option

ticket.description: While the HTML5 FileWriter API is not currently well-supported across the main browsers, it would be nice to have an experimental implementation of multi-file downloads using the FileWriter API for those browsers that do support it. This would possibly enable the downloading of multiple files in a single transaction without the need to confirm the "save file" dialog for each file (and without needing to zip them).
ticket.summary: Investigate possibility of providing an experimental FileWriter implementation for downloads

ticket.description: An option to upload multiple files in parallel rather than sequentially would make it easier to research optimal performance parameters (might be better on SSDs).
ticket.summary: Upload files in parallel

ticket.description:
Currently the progress bars only update at the end of a chunk. This is extremely undesirable with slow upload speeds as it seems as though no progress is being made for a very long time (especially if the default chunk size is high).
A working solution for this exists only in the context of Mozilla Firefox (Tested 23.0.1) which has full support for using xhr.upload.onprogress events with Javascript web workers.
This solution does not apply to Google Chrome (Tested version 29.0.1547.57 m) which has support for xhr.upload.onprogress events but NOT in the context of web workers (the event will only fire at the end of a chunk, and no time before).
Solution does not apply to Internet Explorer (Tested on version 10.0.92) which does NOT have support for xhr.upload.onprogress events but DOES have limited support for xhr.onprogress but web workers will still not update this constantly, only at the end of a chunk.
ticket.summary: Increase update frequency on html5 uploads

ticket.description:
Try sending a file with "Email me on upload complete" ticked and using an optional subject + message. The email to the recipient uses the subject entered and includes the message.
The "upload completed" email sent to the sender doesn't contain the subject and message entered by the user.
As a sender of a bunch of files I wondered what happened, so this is probably not what a user would expect. You'd expect the specific entered subject to be used in both emails.
ticket.summary: Optional subject not used in upload confirmation to sender

ticket.description: Currently To: address prettification only is triggered when you tab to another field. Would be good to also trigger that on pressing "enter".
ticket.summary: trigger To: address prettyfier code on enter in To: field

ticket.description:
FileSender now sends "there's a file for you" messages *on behalf of* and *with the From: address* of the file uploader. This will lead to issues for domains that use SPF.
Some possible ways to deal with this: -FAQ entry that sites using SPF that want to use this as a service should put the filesender box in their SPF records -use the FileSender service email address as From:, and put the user's email address in the body of the message. -under the assumption that SPF works on SMTP envelope level, use the FileSender service email address as envelope from (rfc2821 MAIL FROM:), email address of the person sending the file in RFC822 From:
whichever way we choose, seems that some more configurables are needed....
ticket.summary: devise a solution for SPF records

ticket.description: These two expandable divs (on the upload page) can probably be merged into a single div, as they will both contain settings that can be enabled/disabled through config file.
ticket.summary: Merge "More settings" and "Advanced Settings"

ticket.description:
Display a set of options to allow the sender to choose the amount of emails that they will receive about the file(s) in question. From Jan:
*Options:*
# Only send file to myself. If clicked, put user's email address in To: field, grey out To: box. Ensure you cache any existing content in the To: box in case someone already entered 30 email addresses and then *unticks* the "only send email to self" box. Email to self tick box around the recipient To: # Daily aggregate overview of activity (both uploads and downloads) # Spam me (email receipt for each download) A sender always receives an upload confirmation *unless* the "send file to myself" option is ticked. Note: separate email for "upload confirmation" and "here's a file to download". A download URL is always presented in the "upload complete" landing page. Consideration: mention explicitly that you can also download individual files one at a time through the download page
ticket.summary: Options for email flow on file upload

ticket.description:
Different browsers have different maximum webworker limits. f-20 chrome-60 opera-16 IE-25 Possibly set a hard limit of 16
Needs more research and find out if there is a way to detect max web worker
ticket.summary: Maximum Webworkers - Set Limit

ticket.description:
JS error in console:
SyntaxError: syntax error var fileBoxSize = ; index.php?s=upload&html5=true
ticket.summary: js error: fileBoxSize

ticket.description: Issue with some functions - e.g. functions.php ensureSaneFileUid, ensureSaneOpenSSLKey. These functions should really return Bool as a returned error could be a text string and not picked up as an error.
ticket.summary: Functions return Bool or value - should return bool

ticket.description:
When I use an IE 10 with compatibility view activated I can't choose date and neither choose a file. Is it a known bug? Reported by Iñigo Rodriguez.
Looks like it may be an IE10 Compatibility mode browser issue.
https://connect.microsoft.com/IE/feedback/details/774078
http://bugs.jquery.com/ticket/12577
IE 10 compativility mode causes a "SCRIPT3: Member not found" script error which stops all scripts.
Without being able to fix the issue in IE we can add <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge"> to the head of index.php and this will force IE to not use compativility mode. Stops the issue happening if someone tries to use IE10-Compatibility mode.
Doesn’t solve the issue of what is really causing the problem which seems to be a browser issue.
ticket.summary: IE 10 Compatibility mode script error

ticket.description: Users should be able to see which email address they are currently signed into, the most reasonable place for this is to place a message in the status bar when a page is loaded. (it will be replaced by other status messages if need be)
ticket.summary: 'You are logged in as' status bar message

ticket.description: Consider ways to decrease the overall page height, to avoid the need to scroll down to see the "Send" button on multiupload.php (on 1680x1050 or lower resolutions).
ticket.summary: Multi upload page height

ticket.description: Currently there is no message to notify the user that the voucher they added has actually been added. (Unless of course if you look in the new vouchers list) 1.5 had a "Voucher Sent" message.
ticket.summary: Voucher Message

ticket.description:
The nested table layout in files.php causes a lot of database queries to be made, particularly related to calculating number of downloads per file / per user. This scales poorly as the numbers of transactions, recipients and files increase. Many of the calculations can be performed in PHP code (or pre-calculated with the help of ticket #1014).
As suggested by Chris, it would also help to only load the basic "top-level" data necessary to display the main table on page load, and use AJAX to load the details if/when the user expands a table row.
ticket.summary: Reduce number of DB queries made on page load in files.php

ticket.description:
When an Authenticated user is uploading a files/s and authentication is lost/logged out the console returns ErrorAuth but user is not notified.
To reproduce: Logon to Filesender Open 2 browser tabs Start a large file upload in one browser tab While upload is progressing - logout in the other tab Uploading tab hangs without notifying user.
This same issue will happen if SAML times out during a very long upload.
Need to notify user that they are no longer Authenticated. Additionally in 1.6 we tested code to allow the upload to complete to prevent frustration with extremely long file uploads. But then valid sessions were the next issue.
See ticket #905
ticket.summary: ErrorAuth on Upload when Auth is lost

ticket.description: The user shouldn't have to manually alter the address bar to get to the single upload page, index.php should handle the redirecting to the single upload page if they are unable to use the html5 content and direct them to multiupload.php if they can.
ticket.summary: Redirect users based on browsers capabilities

ticket.description: Currently, using the test string '<tag> text &"'></?\n'" as a message in an email only produces 'text &"'>' as a response. Based on the rule of 'what goes in must come out', this must be fixed such that the message appears exactly the same on both ends.
ticket.summary: Character encoding in emails

ticket.description: As suggested by Jan, the 'Start download' button on the single download page is too large and needs to be reduced. This also applies to the same button on the multi-file download page.
ticket.summary: Reduce button size on single download pages

ticket.description: The current implementation only checks that a single file 'n' is valid and not all of the files in the upload box. This therefore needs to be redesigned such that it checks all files in the upload queue rather than just a single one. Credit to Chris Richter for finding the bug
ticket.summary: Redesign file validation for multi-file uploads

ticket.description: To help reduce the number of DB queries made from files.php.

ticket.description: If for any reason an upload fails (browser crash, server error, etc) the issued guest voucher gets used and is no longer usable, a new one has to be issued. This shouldn't be the case, the voucher should only be consumed when a transaction has successfully finished uploading.

Reported by Guido.
The "send files" item in the top menu is not active / highlighted as it should be if the "s" parameter (e.g. s=upload) is missing from the URL.

2013/10/01 07:58:38 [Session ID: 4klmg6tmja522o1u350a4gvlr1] E_ERROR: SQLSTATE[42S22]: Column not found: 1054 Unknown column 'fileenabledownloadreceipts' in 'field list'[127.0.0.1(127.0.0.1)]

ticket.summary: Duplicated files on results page for single uploads

ticket.description: Make the height of the files box on multiupload.php configurable through config.php, allowing the server admin to control how many files will fit before a scroll bar is displayed.
ticket.summary: Configurable height on upload field

ticket.description:
Under some very specific conditions the logs might get polluted with: 
E_ERROR: No mapping for en-au found. Please check your language configuration.
This will happen when: - a customised config/locale.php does *NOT* contain a mapping for en-au - $config['site_defaultlanguage'] is either "en_AU" or not defined - none of the language tags sent by the browser is found in the customised config/locale.php The 'error' here is that the en-au => en_AU.php mapping is not present in the customised config/locale.php Stricty speaking this shouldn't be an error since in all cases FileSender will use the default en_AU.php definitions. The specific error message is meant to detect for example a missing mapping when $config['site_defaultlanguage'] is *not* "en_AU" and the corresponding mapping in locale.php is missing.
ticket.summary: "E_ERROR: No mapping for en-au found" when no mapping for default language is found

ticket.description: As spotted by Wendy and confirmed on my Win7 box: when the page resets (with IE9 at least) after cancelling an upload, Selenium doesn't recognise that the page has finished resetting (and times out before advancing to the next step). I had originally thought this was a quirk of Selenium (which doesn't always handle waiting as expected), however I noticed that the mouse pointer keeps spinning.
ticket.summary: IE9 mouse pointer keeps spinning after canceling an upload

ticket.description: fs_multi_upload.php (line 224) currently reads chunks into memory and stores them to disk by reading 1000000 bytes at a time. Since an upload chunk size already exists, that can be used instead.
ticket.summary: fs_multi_upload chunking chunks in fread()

ticket.description: Files that fail validation in multiupload.php (e.g. due to invalid file extensions) are striked through in the files box, but the user may need to scroll to notice this. This can lead to confusion. It would be better to move the scroll bar programmatically such that the error is displayed clearly. Alternatively, list invalid files at the top of the files box.

ticket.description:
Currently when removing a file from the upload box, no errors are displayed but the page will hang on a 'Cannot call method 'split' of undefined' error.
This needs to be fixed such that removing a file visibly removes it from the fileupload box and doesn't cause any problems with validation.

ticket.description:
Add server config variables for the max number of files and max aggregate file size that can be uploaded in one go.
The limits should be clearly displayed somewhere near the drag&drop box, e.g.: "xx/100 files selected" "Max size 100 TB, 0.0001 TB used"

ticket.description:
Multiupload.js & upload.js share a large portion of identical code which can be solved by moving these functions into common.js to further reduce duplicate code.
EDIT: Changed from multi/upload.php to multi/upload. js. Refactoring of php files is encapsulated within ticket #948
EDIT 2: Common.js should contain function 'updateProgressBar(..)' which should should be changed to work for both single/multi-file uploads and terasender/non-terasender

ticket.description:
Note: this is NOT a show stopping issue and can perfectly well be fixed after 1.5. But a fine example of how we need to revisit error logging throughout the code, ensuring it is both consistent, it starts to adhere to various "log levels", service-affecting issues are logged in filesender.log and errors in the UI are meaningful.
unable to connect to database and debug=true results in the following (expected) entry in the filesender logfile:
2011/10/12 03:07:09 [Session ID: none] Error: [2] pg_connect(): Unable to connect to PostgreSQL server: FATAL: database "filesende" does not exist : /usr/share/php/MDB2/Driver/pgsql.php [435] [86.62.167.38(86.62.167.38)]
unable to connect to database and debug=false results in no entry in the filesender logfile and in the following message to the user:
Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'DBALException' with message 'Error executing query: MDB2 Error: connect failed' in /var/www/filesender-1.5/classes/DBAL.php:280 Stack trace: #0 /var/www/filesender-1.5/classes/Log.php(136): DBAL->exec('? IN...', '', '', 'Error', '', '', '2011-10-12 03:1...', '', '', 'Error executing...', 'a9f348deeaad60f...') #1 /var/www/filesender-1.5/classes/Functions.php(381): Log->saveLog('', 'Error', 'Error executing...') #2 /var/www/filesender-1.5/pages/vouchers.php(134): Functions->getVouchers() #3 /var/www/filesender-1.5/www/index.php(222): require_once('/var/www/filese...') #4 {main} thrown in /var/www/filesender-1.5/classes/DBAL.php on line 280
ticket.summary: Error handling: no error handling when debug=false and database connection failure

ticket.description: Database queries currently use either prepared statements or DB::query(). Change DB.php to use prepared statements exclusively and ensure that all queries are passed through that.
ticket.summary: Change DB calls to use prepared statements exclusively

ticket.description: Control page content loaded based on client side HTML5 capabilities. Only load flash if required with single upload or load multi-file with HTML5.
ticket.summary: Load Flash and HTML5 upload pages on demand

ticket.description:
There should be an effort to reduce the amount of replica code throughout the various filesender pages. Proposed splitting is as follows:
All upload code shared between multi/upload pages should be placed into: upload_common_js.php
all calendar related code (including that in vouchers.php) should be placed into: calendar_js.php
The most logical destination for these files is in the 'www' directory.
ticket.summary: Reduce repeated code throughout single/multi-files and vouchers pages

ticket.description:
Credit to Jan for pointing this one out:
A 64-bit version of PHP is required for much of FileSender to work properly, but this is not currently being checked anywhere in the code. An error message (similar to what happens if config.php is not found) should be generated if the PHP installation is found to be 32-bit aware only.
See http://stackoverflow.com/a/6304354 for one possible way to perform such a check.
ticket.summary: Add check for 64-bit PHP installation

ticket.description:
Files linked via a common groupID should be organised such that their common fields (subject, message, expiry date, total number of downloads, total size) should be displayed as an upload. This should be expandable to find out details about the individual files of the upload (name, size, number of times downloaded).
Single file uploads should be displayed similar to the way they are already displayed but with styling that is consistent to the changes mentioned above.
ticket.summary: Updated myFiles to cater for multiple uploads

ticket.description:
Document type declaration should be changed to <!DOCTYPE HTML> to properly reflect that Filesender uses HTML5. The old "XHTML Transitional" doctype causes validation to fail in cases where new HTML5 attributes are used.
Will need to revalidate HTML after changing.
ticket.summary: Update !DOCTYPE declaration

ticket.description: The landing page should provide a download link to the newly uploaded file(s). It might also be beneficial to mention explicitly that files can be downloaded individually from the "MyFiles" page.
ticket.summary: Improve the "upload complete" landing page

ticket.description: The multi-file download page should somehow inform the user that they are about to receive a "Compressed (zipped) folder" (rather than a series of separate files). This information only needs to appear if multiple files are selected for download.
ticket.summary: Inform user about zipped file downloads

ticket.description:
Display in the progress bar dialog:
* Time used / estimated time remaining * Average upload speed so far Nice to have: log the time used for an upload in the database.
ticket.summary: Display aggregate upload time / speed estimates

ticket.description:
As it stands the button is unable to function, as there new my files must work via operate via the 'filegroupid' field rather than 'fileid'.
This has a few solutions which need to be discussed prior to its implementation can start, possible solutions include:
* A delete button for every individual file contained in the group
* Deleting the entire filegroupid and all of its contents
* Provide the user with some form of checklist where they can choose which files they wish to delete (much like how they select files they wish to download in multidownload.php)
ticket.summary: New functionality for 'Delete' button on multi-file 'my files' page

ticket.description:
The ZIP files produced by Zipper.php don't currently work with the Mac OS X Archive Utility. Depending on the value of the "version needed to extract" header that is sent with the file, one of two behaviours occurs:
* The .zip file unzips to a .cpgz file, which unzips to a .zip file, which unzips to a .cpgz file, and so on (see [[url:http://linlog.skepticats.com/entries/2012/02/Streaming_ZIP_files_in_PHP.php|here]]). * An error message is produced: _Error 2: No such file or directory_
The unzip terminal command appears to work without reporting any errors.
We also need to test the files with other common clients. In Windows 7 (x64), both the default Windows Explorer utility and WinRAR are able to handle the files. In Ubuntu 13.04 (x64), the unzip terminal command works fine.
ticket.summary: Ensure ZIP files work with most common clients
document migration postgresql -> mysql as per arnes docs

ticket.description:
The goal of quota support is to be able to restrict how many resources a user uses.
Option 1: cumulative upload-size limit: a maximum to the total size of active files a user has on a FileSender install Option 2: time-relative upload-size limit per user: a user can only upload a certain amount of data in a certain time frame Option 3: max. number of uploads in a certain time period
Option (3) sounds illogical: the resource consumed is the amount of disk, not the amount of network sockets. Option (1) might be the most logical one as it offers a user some form of control: if they go over their quota, they can encourage the downloader to download quickly so they get free upload slots again.
It ought to be a system-wide setting, one size fits all. User-specific settings we have no way to maintain, so those need to come out of the authentication source.
ticket.summary: Quota support [M]

ticket.description:
As suggested by Olav Isak Rokstad Sjøflot from UNINETT FAS:
An email or other way to summarise, once the file has expired, who of the recipients actually downloaded the file.
I can't recall we have this already, as the new MyFiles in qwa is based still on the file-recipient principle. A grouped "show me all for this file" overview is not there yet.
ticket.summary: Summary tabel of file recipients and actual downloaders *after expiry*

ticket.description: Current workflow depends partly (a.o. for voucher uploads) on PHP session specific variables. Since a PHP session is browser specific and cannot (without extrs measures) distinguish between actions done from different browser tabs or windows this will 'break'for example simultaneous voucher uploads (multiple uploads using a voucher from the same browser session at the same time). We might need extra code to generate a window/tab specific identifier that can be used to separate actions. See a.o. http://www.php.net/manual/en/ref.session.php#74557
ticket.summary: PHP session management and multiple tabs/windows per browser

ticket.description: Current code uses has of filename for creating temp files. To prevent issues when to files with exactly the same name get uploaded simultaneously, a session ID needs to be added, similarly to how it's now being done in 1.5.
ticket.summary: Implement session id in temp files with TeraSender

ticket.description:
Going through File Upload javascript with new upload code and make sure error messages are displayed when needed.
New code is a module. If there is a problem in whatever the module is doing, it doesn't send an error message back to the client yet. Hoping the module returns proper error codes so error messages can be done in the file upload javascript.
ticket.summary: Adapt error messages in upload code to using external upload module

ticket.description: Due to the encryption the percentage complete is off when encrypting. We might do an educated guess
ticket.summary: Upload progress calculation for encrypted files

ticket.description: Uploading a zero sized chunk is now treated as a valid chunk, this should generate an error. Triggered by failed uploads with the FireFox nightly (13 alpha) on AARNet install.
ticket.summary: Catch zero size chunk uploads

ticket.description: When issuing a voucher, if one enters an invalid email address the "Invalid or missing email" warning appears, however subsequently entering a valid email address does not clear the warning (but does when uploading a file) until after one clicks on the "Send Voucher" button. (To note only: if one does not enter an email address at all, the warning correctly (as discussed in #695) does not appear until after clicking on "Send (Voucher)" in both workflows).
ticket.summary: Email validity check logic when issuing voucher

ticket.description: Thijs (as an experienced debian packager) suggested both on- and offline some usefull improvements to the debian packaging. Based on the suggestions Thijs and I decided that going to a more modern way (using some other tooling) of debian packaging is the way forward. This (including MySQL/dbconfig) will be looked at in more detail in the beta3 cycle.
ticket.summary: Improvements to debian packaging

ticket.description: It looks like the #file_msg div is emptied before the .show. Most likely related to the fileMsg() calls.
ticket.summary: Filename errors from backend are not reported in the frontend UI

ticket.description:
For example, if you are on the upload page disable the 'Send file' button, if you are on the My Files page disable that one etc.
Use case pro: people who accidently press the 'Send file' button instead of the (much bigger) Send button lose all filled in info
Use case against: the 'Send file' button can be used as a kind of 'refresh'/'clear'

ticket.description: en/decrypting appears to (as expected) very CPU intensive, both with upload and download When downloading (with Chrome at least) it also tends to freeze the browser window (progress spinning wheel 'hangs', progressbar updates are slow)
ticket.summary: Crypto: performance
Make disabling filesize check on back-end conditional on encryption

ticket.description: When several vouchers have been issued to the same recipient with the same expiry date, and then one or more of them is used or deleted, a url to the voucher in the Guest Voucher table would make it easier for the voucher issuer to confirm the url(s) of still-active voucher(s).
